entries.name: length
entries.desc: The length of the message in octets.

entries.name: number
entries.desc: The sequence number of the message on the server.

entries.name: size
entries.desc: The length of the message in octets.

entries.name: delete()
entries.desc: Marks a message for deletion on the server.  Deletion does not actually occur until the end of the session; deletion may be cancelled for all marked messages by calling Net::POP3#reset.

entries.name: deleted?()
entries.desc: True if the mail has been deleted.

entries.name: inspect()
entries.desc: Provide human-readable stringification of class state.

entries.name: pop( dest = +'' )
entries.desc: This method fetches the message.  If called with a block, the message is yielded to the block one chunk at a time.  If called without a block, the message is returned as a String.  The optional dest argument will be prepended to the returned String; this argument is essentially obsolete.

entries.name: top(lines, dest = +'')
entries.desc: Fetches the message header and lines lines of body.

entries.name: unique_id()
entries.desc: Returns the unique-id of the message. Normally the unique-id is a hash string of the message.
